page.title: 07The Gothenburg city Wreck
page.content: On the night of the 26th June 1891, during a thick fog. The iron steamer, the, "GOTHENBURG CITY," of Hartlepool ran aground on a rock skeer just South of St Mary's Island. Every effort was made to refloat the vessel but she had to be abandoned. Before the ship up, a man who visited her gave a remarkable description of the rats which infested the wreck. This is an article which is dated from the local newspaper, dated 23rd Feb,1892. "I was one of a party who went aboard that unlucky vessel a few days before she broke up, and saw a sight to be remembered. I shall never forget it, to all appearances as we approached her, the vessel might have been sailing comfortably out of harbour, save for the absense of any life onboard her. But we have no sooner a foot on deck then we were immediately attacked in such of us as
